Description: Body fragment of an Ionian (?) pottery cup; inside, broad black band between reserved areas; outside, mostly black, with reserved area (orientation uncertain).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Leiden University, Faculty of Archaeology. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Prins de Jong 1925 / Scherben aus Naukratis: Aus der Sammlung des Universitäts-Professors Dr Fr W Freih von Bissing (p. 61, no. 16)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.405)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: T.2948 (Musée Scheurleer (The Hague) Registration number)
Miscellaneous number: VII.16 (cat. no. in Prins de Jong 1925)
